basics.name: Wyatt Bartlett
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: Aloha, I am a student pursuing a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Fall, 2017, after which I will pursue a career in software engineering.

work.summary: Maintain and upgrade MS SQL Server and MS Access databases used by STAR clients
highlights: Improve database structure and design queries for easier and faster manipulation of data
Troubleshoot and debug Visual Basic modules

work.summary: Manage house operations for performances at Mae Zenke Orvis Auditorium
highlights: Operate and maintain sound and light equipment
Record student concert attendance in Excel

volunteer.summary: Volunteered with a group of UH Honors students to assist various community groups
highlights: Raised funds for American Cancer Society through Relay for Life
Restored native bird habitat on Kāneʻohe Marine Base
Participated in UHM campus trash clean-up

awards.title: First Place - Landslide Early Warning System
awards.awarder: Indigenous Knowledge in Engineering (IKE) Student Symposium
awards.summary: John Nihi and I gave a winning presentation for the Landslide Early Warning System project.  Please see my Projects page for more details.

awards.title: Walter and Jeane Lum Scholarship Fund
awards.summary: The purpose of this Fund is to provide scholarships to assist students at the University of Hawai`i at Manoa College of Engineering, who provide leadership in the areas of: student mentorship, academic leadership, student-college outreach leadership, and leadership in research.
